definition: thin or slender/finely particulate/thin and soft/fine/delicate/trifling/(of a sound) quiet/frugal
ministry/department/section/part/division/troops/board/classifier for works of literature, films, machines etc

sentences.english: This precise drawing glimmers in the architectural detail.
sentences.chinese: 這在建築細部的繪製曙光。

sentences.english: Frame the detail in the center of the photo, and then on the edge.
sentences.chinese: 將細部構圖在相片的中心點，接着再試試邊緣。

sentences.english: She was exquisitely fashioned in very small texture and detail.
sentences.chinese: 她每一個微小的紋理和細部都塑造得優美絕倫。

sentences.english: The article makes an investigation on the detailed relationship between Su Ci-poem and Liu's, and its meaning in Ci-poem history.
sentences.chinese: 本文考察蘇詞之於柳詞的細部關係及其詞史意義。

sentences.english: I also scribed some panel lines and put some accessories on the surface of the model.
sentences.chinese: 另外我在模型的表面加上一些細部和一點刻線作裝飾。

sentences.english: In chapter one, the concept, intension and extension of the details are put out.
sentences.chinese: 本文第一章闡明瞭建築細部的概念及其內涵和外延。

sentences.english: As with detail, many meanings can be seen in every photograph.
sentences.chinese: 在細部的襯托下，每張相片都被付予了意義。

sentences.english: Detailed decoration is to emphasize the shoulder and neck, shoulder and collar cloud of Qing Dynasty clothing.
sentences.chinese: 細部裝飾是強調肩和脖子的清代雲肩和領衣。

sentences.english: As part of the plan, they had to begin with the engineering design for the tracks throughout the city.
sentences.chinese: 按照計畫，首先要著手進行整個城市鋪軌的細部設計。

sentences.english: It requires that the works is not only lively in whole, but as well as vivid in detail.
sentences.chinese: 作品不但要求整體活潑完備，更必要細部耐看有神。

sentences.english: Please check by eye to make fine correction.
sentences.chinese: 請用眼睛檢查，做細部的調整。

definition: the feeling of actually being there
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
to seem almost genuine/easily mistaken for the real thing
to decorate/to adorn/to dress up/to polish (a written piece)/to qualify or modify (grammar)
